title: Sharp-edged serif

author: antofa

comments.content:
Looks like a squooshed ITC Juice.

- Lex

Lex is right. Here's a link to [Juice](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831061713/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/juice-itc/). In this case, 'squooshed' means flattened/widened.

- Mike Yanega

You're great! Your help was very useful.  
Thank you very much, guys.

i'd have to disagree fellow font-trackers. it's too mid-century for juice, looks like something off an old record album. i think it's hand cut rubilith kind of stuff and shot directly onto the print plate.

In the spirit of unbridled creativity,

Troy Vera  
Kingdom Graphics  
 [http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831061713/http:/www.kingdomgraphics.biz/ "http://www.kingdomgraphics.biz")  
Yahoo IM: kingdom\_graphics  
Skype: kingdom\_graphics

Troy, I have to disagree with your assessment. Just because the image is not in color doesn't mean it's vintage work. The image below shows the posted sample with a sample I just made with ITC Juice widened to 184%.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831061713im_/http:/typophile.com/files/backJuice184_4326.gif)
